pros:
Good work environment 
Online learning tools to help with career opportunities 
Tuition assistance

cons: Not a lot of opportunity to move up

pros: Small tight community. Very passionate instructors and staff.
cons: Limited resources. Good old boys leadership approach.

pros:
Great benefits
Small and tight knit
cons:
Could be more forward-looking
Could line up more with higher ed

pros: I met some of the most wonderful people that I will be friends with forever.
cons: The management at Seminole State is reactive instead of proactive.  My boss had worked at Seminole for 10-15 years and did not know any policies; thus when we needed procedures for our department she was incapable or creating structure and efficiency for the work environment.  It was a very disorganized and unhealthy work environment.  She would have 3 or 4 parties a week, but the opportunity to do a meaningful days work never occurred.  The number of personal issues discussed on a daily basis interferes with work productivity.  It is a very emotional environment where the bosses believe that they come to work to mother those with emotional issues and people that want to work are penalized for doing a good job.

job_title: Instructional Support Specialist in Oviedo, FL
pros: The main benefit to this position is the flexible schedule. After the first term I was able to set my own hours within the operating hours of the center and total allowed for the position. I worked there for four years mainly because of the professional atmosphere and positive relationships I developed with my colleagues. I was also able to work on a second degree while at the job as long as I kept up with my responsibilities.
cons: I would have stayed longer except the position offers no movement or growth. It is what it is: a part-time role without benefits. While one could certainly watch for other positions to open within the college and apply to those, no opportunity for full-time status exits within this role. Sometimes the college would limit the amount of hours ISS could work due to budgeting, which was a detractor for me as well.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Lake Mary, FL
pros: Most of the students are great to work with as are the staff I worked with directly.
cons:
IT setup isn't always optimal. Works for most people, but inflexible if you need special setups in a classroom. The eLearning website I used was horrible - slow, confusing, hard to copy classes from one term to another. I'm told they are looking to replace, if so that would be great.

Like most colleges now, they rely upon adjuncts for most of the teaching load. You won't know what classes you have due to enrollments, and won't get most benefits.

pros: I got a chance to learn so much here. They have a great group of knowledgeable employees. If your starting out they can help you learn and grow.
cons: The pay is well below industry standards. They will not get rid of people who should have been let go years ago. They expect too much from their employees especially considering the pay.

review_title: Passionate people. Leadership struggles to understand employees
pros:
People in the trenches are absolutely amazing to work with.
Great small college in rural setting
Wonderful programs that are grant funded
Some unique benefits such as Spring Break off and adjusted summer schedules for Fridays off.
cons:
Leadership struggles to understand employee needs.
Old politics (both internal and external) has huge influence on leadership decision making.
Under qualified lower leadership. No supervisory training for faculty who move to administrative/leadership roles.
Accountability is inconsistent. A lot of inconsistencies - decisions/actions are misaligned with mission and values.

pros: Being able to adapt my work schedule to my class schedule each semester made college more affordable.  Working with a variety of students and teachers gave me insight toward a future career in education.
cons: Being capped at 25 hours to ensure that I did not qualify as full-time.

job_title: Grant Program Specialist in Seminole, OK
pros:
Any breaks that students are out, employees are off as well. 
7hr work days from August-May, 8a-4p.
8hr work days June & July, 8a-5p, but off on Fridays during the summer.
cons: They prefer you to have a masters with experience but the salary is absolutely atrocious!

review_title: Was laid off for telling the truth
cons: The previous supervisors need to move on.

review_title: Great place to work, especially in IT
pros: IT department is one of the best areas to work  for because of dedication of management.
cons: Salary needs to be more competitive.

pros: Great colleagues and good eLearning support.
cons: Run by people who have never taught and have no idea how to support teachers.

pros: Flexibility to teach in campus and or online
cons: Travelling long distance between campuses when assigned classes

pros: It's a job and a paycheck.
Great coworkers and same vision - to help the students.
cons: Getting a lying and evil supervisor.
